FacilityName: Jennie-O Turkey, Store, Inc. Pelican Rapids

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

    

West Central Turkey, LLC produces primarily finished turkey products at our facility located in Pelican Rapids, MN. We have a strong commitment to operate our facility in a safe and responsible manner. 



Ammonia is used at our facility as the cooling medium in our refrigeration system. The ammonia is contained in a closed loop system; it is designed to remain inside the piping and vessels in our facility.  We believe that ammonia provides the safest and most efficient cooling choice for our operation. 



A. Describe the Accident Release Prevention and Emergency Policies 

We take many precautions to prevent or minimize accidental releases of ammonia from the refrigeration system.  These precautions include safety controls (alarms and automatic shutdown devices) which are designed to identify and prevent potentially unsafe conditions like pressure increases that could cause a system failure.  We also have a preventive maintenance program designed to maintain the on-going integrity of the systems, a training program designed to ensure that the systems are operated by qualified personnel and emergency response procedures that enable trained personnel to respond quickly to system upsets. 



The Manager of Plant Engineering and the Utility Engineer are responsible for the management of these ammonia safety programs. 



B. Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled 

Ammonia is the only substance covered by the Accidental Release Prevention Regulations handled at this facility. 



C. Description of the Accidental Release Prevention Program 

The facility has an accident release prevention program that complies with Occupational Safety and Health 

Act's Process Safety Management Standard and EPA's Risk Management Program Rule. The prevention program consists of the following elements: 

?    Employee Participation Program

?    Process Safety Information

?    Process Hazard Analysis

?    Operating Procedures

?    Training Program

?    Contractor Safe

ty Program

?    Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures

?    Mechanical Integrity Program

?    Hot Work Permit Procedures

?    Management of Change Procedures

?    Incident Investigation Procedures

?    Compliance Audit Procedures 



D. Five-Year Accident History 

West Central Turkeys has had one ammonia-related incident that occurred at the facility over the past five years that resulted in a ammonia release. This incident involved a liquid drainer that ruptured on evaporator  (Z-252) releasing approximately 17 lbs of Ammonia. 

 

E. Description of the Emergency Response Program 

An emergency response program has been implemented at the facility. This program contains procedures describing how the facility will respond to ammonia spills and other emergencies, including evacuation procedures.  The program has been coordinated with local fire department officials. 



F. Planned Changes to Improve Safety 

We have identified (one) potential change to improve the safety of our ammonia refrigeration system. West Central Turkeys will continue with upgrading safety relief valve vent projects as well as adding additional ammonia detection in areas of concern. Operators will continue hands-on/verbal training on the ammonia refrigeration system.
